title.value: Human-Centered Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Current & Future Trends
title.justification: Title of the provided research paper from arXiv
title.quote: Human-Centered Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Current & Future Trends

extractions.description: This research paper discusses the ongoing and future trends in Human-Centered Responsible Artificial Intelligence (HCR-AI). It highlights the importance of developing AI systems that are ethical, transparent, and beneficial to humanity. The paper aims to bring together researchers from academia and industry to map the current and future research trends in HCR-AI, fostering collaboration and idea-sharing for advancing this field.

type.justification: The paper focuses on gathering and analyzing current research trends and tools in the field of HCR-AI.
type.quote: We believe a SIG dedicated to the HCR-AI at CHI 2023 will benefit the CHI community and help build and establish a broader network of researchers and provide a mapping and understanding of current and future trends in this area.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on Human-Centered Responsible Artificial Intelligence, which falls under Human-Centered AI
name.quote: Human-Centered Responsible Artificial Intelligence (HCR-AI) aims to bring people and their values into the design and development of AI systems

name.justification: The paper discusses various ethical aspects in the design of AI systems, such as fairness, transparency, and accountability.
name.quote: Ethics in AI involve socio-cultural and technical factors, spanning a range of responsible AI values (including but not limited to transparency, fairness, explainability, accountability, autonomy, sustainability, and trust).

name.justification: The paper focuses on integrating human values and socio-technical aspects in AI system design, which is a core aspect of Human-Computer Interaction.
name.quote: Aligned with responsible AI are calls to make AI more human-centric. In particular, there is an emphasis on the challenges of AI integration into socio-technical processes to preserve human autonomy and control, as well as the impacts of AI systems deployment and applications on society, organizations, and individuals.

name.justification: The paper mentions the IBM AI Fairness 360 as a tool developed to build responsible AI systems.
name.quote: New tools and frameworks are now being proposed to help developers build more responsible AI systems (e.g., IBM’s 360 suites on fairness and explainability)

referenced_paper_title.justification: Referenced IBM suite in the context of fairness and explainability.
referenced_paper_title.quote: New tools and frameworks are now being proposed to help developers build more responsible AI systems (e.g., IBM’s 360 suites on fairness and explainability [18, 25] and Fairlearn [3])
